name: disciplinable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A disciplinable action is one that someone can be disciplined (= punished) for, and a disciplinable person is someone who can be disciplined: disciplinable offence Stealing from an employer is usually a disciplinable offence. It is unclear whether they would be disciplinable under the proposed law.
More examplesFewer examplesHelping yourself to some milk from the office fridge is not normally a disciplinable offence.His behaviour is not only disappointing, it's a potentially disciplinable action.A union official whose misconduct falls into this category is disciplinable only to the same extent as other employees.
